intro: Benzoina, commonly known as the benzoin tree, is a member of the Burseraceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic resin, which is harvested from its bark and used in various traditional and commercial applications. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy appearance. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall and produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by orange-red fruits.
